text.text_translated:
Suzanne Collins always felt sad when she saw news about wars.  
She was a child.  
Her dad was a pilot in the US Air Force.  
He fought in Vietnam.  
Her mother tried to keep her safe.  
She did not tell her about the war.  
But she still saw news about the war.  
She knew her dad was there.  
It was a very scary experience for her.
